meanings.definition: To strike with a resounding blow.
meanings.sent1: He whopped the ball with his bat.
meanings.sent2: She whopped the door closed in anger.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally whopped the pot off the stove.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm whopped the trees with heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The hammer whopped the nail into the wood.

meanings.sent1: The whop of the hammer echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: He felt the whop of the punch in his gut.
meanings.sent3: The whop of the drum caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The whop of the falling tree startled the birds.
meanings.sent5: The whop of the gavel signaled the end of the trial.

meanings.sent1: The rabbit whopped out of the bushes.
meanings.sent2: She whopped into the room, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel whopped up the tree in a hurry.
meanings.sent4: The car whopped around the corner with screeching tires.
meanings.sent5: The wind whopped through the open window, scattering papers.
